1K and P). In contrast, mucilage papillae were formed from the basal epidermis of the
mutant as in the wild type (Figure 1U, V, and W). There
was no distinct impairment in the other aspects of vegetative development in the
mutants compared to the wild type (
growth rate of thalli, air chamber formation,
and rhizoid development). These observations suggest that the initial stage of gemma
